topic.title: Home
topic.section: There are two "Home" pages: one for a site-level Home Page, Main Site of Open Conference Systems; the other is for a conference-level Home Page. These two home pages are similar in many ways, but differ in certain respects.

Upon accessing the Main Site Home Page you will be provided with a description of the site as a whole, and a list of conferences residing on the site. From here you can access a conference Home Page, access any available current conferences, and also register with the conference. The available navigation features on Main Site are as follows:

Top Navigation Bar

Home and About provide an overview of all conferences on the site, rather than an individual conference.

Log In allows you to create a user profile if you have not already done so. See {help_topic key="user.registerAndProfile" text="Register and Profile"}. The Log In link will be replaced with a User Home link once you register and log in. See {help_topic key="user.userHome" text="User Home"}.

Account allows you to create an account with the conference.

Search allows you to search the entire site or just an individual conference. See {help_topic key="user.searchAndBrowse" text="Search and Browse"}.

Right Navigation Bar

Open Conference Systems link will take you to the Public Knowledge Project website, which provides resources for OCS system and OA research and practice.

Conference Help link provides context-dependent online help.

Form under User allows you to log in with username and password. After logging in you will be taken to your User Home page. Once logged in, there will be links under User to a list of conferences you have registered, and to your account.

Language allows you to choose the language supported by OCS.

The search field under Conference Content allows you to conduct basic search through the site with a few criteria. For an advanced search, use the Search link on the top navigation bar.

Font Size allows you to adjust the font size of the site.

The home page for a conference can be reached when clicking on View Conference or Current Conference under the conference's title on the site home page, or when a conference's title is clicked from User Home. The available navigation features on Conference Home Page are as follows:

Top Navigation Bar

Home and About provide information about the particular conference.

Log In and Account work as mentioned above.

User Home appears once you have logged in, and displays the user home page. This page provides links to your conference roles, and to your account.

Search provides extensive search options, for searching all conferences or a particular conference.

Current Conferences displays the information regarding the current conferences, if available.

Archives displays the titles of previous conferences, if available. Clicking on the title of a previous conference will show related information.

Announcements link appears on the top navigation bar if enabled by the Conference Manager. Clicking on this link will access the announcements page.

Right Navigation Bar

Open Conference Systems link will take you to the Public Knowledge Project website, which provides resources for OCS system and OA research and practice.

Conference Help link provides context-dependent online help.

Form under User allows you to log in with username and password. After logging in you will be taken to your User Home page. Once logged in, there will be links under User to a list of conferences you have registered, and to your account.

Language allows you to choose the language supported by OCS.

The search field under Conference Content allows you to conduct basic search through the site with a few criteria. For an advanced search, use the Search link on the top navigation bar.

Browse allows you to browse by conference, by author, or by title.

Font Size allows you to adjust the font size of the site.

There is also Information for Readers in the right navigation bar.
Breadcrumb links are offered at the top of the page, just below top navigation bar, in both situations.
